str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To eat up, eat till it is finished, devour, squander, annoy, injure. From kata and esthio; to eat down, i.e. Devour.
Feminine of a presumed derivative apparently from the base of chasma through the idea of deficiency; a widow, literally or figuratively.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.
A pretext, an excuse. From a compound of pro and phaino; an outward showing, i.e. Pretext.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To pray, pray for, offer prayer. From pros and euchomai; to pray to God, i.e. Supplicate, worship.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
From peri; superabundant or superior; by implication, excessive; adverbially violently; neuter preeminence.
